title: 1763-C
statement: C. Another Array Problemtime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given an array $$$a$$$ of $$$n$$$ integers. You are allowed to perform the following operation on it as many times as you want (0 or more times):Choose $$$2$$$ indices $$$i$$$,$$$j$$$ where $$$1 \\le i < j \\le n$$$ and replace $$$a_k$$$ for all $$$i \\leq k \\leq j$$$ with $$$|a_i - a_j|$$$Print the maximum sum of all the elements of the final array that you can obtain in such a way.InputThe first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 10^5$$$) — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains a single integer $$$n$$$ ($$$2 \\le n \\le 2 \\cdot 10^5$$$) — the length of the array $$$a$$$.The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1, a_2, \\ldots, a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\le a_i \\le 10^9$$$) — the elements of array $$$a$$$.It's guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$2 \\cdot 10^5$$$.OutputFor each test case, print the sum of the final array.ExampleInput331 1 129 134 9 5Output3 16 18NoteIn the first test case, it is not possible to achieve a sum $$$> 3$$$ by using these operations, therefore the maximum sum is $$$3$$$.In the second test case, it can be shown that the maximum sum achievable is $$$16$$$. By using operation $$$(1,2)$$$ we transform the array from $$$[9,1]$$$ into $$$[8,8]$$$, thus the sum of the final array is $$$16$$$.In the third test case, it can be shown that it is not possible to achieve a sum $$$> 18$$$ by using these operations, therefore the maximum sum is $$$18$$$.

You are given an array of $n$ integers. You can repeatedly choose two indices $i$ and $j$ ($1 \le i < j \le n$) and replace all elements from index $i$ to $j$ with the absolute difference between the elements at indices $i$ and $j$.  

Find the maximum possible sum of all the elements in the array after performing these operations any number of times.


Input:

* The first line contains the number of test cases, $t$.
* For each test case:
    * The first line contains the length of the array, $n$.
    * The second line contains $n$ integers, the elements of the array.

Output:

For each test case, print the maximum sum of the array elements after performing the operations.

You are given a list of numbers. You can repeatedly choose two numbers in the list and replace all the numbers between them with the absolute difference between those two numbers. What is the largest possible sum of all the numbers in the list after performing these operations?
